meanings.definition: Bring bad luck to (someone or something)
meanings.sent1: She believed she was jinxing the team by wearing her lucky socks.
meanings.sent2: He was afraid of jinxing his chances by talking about his upcoming job interview.
meanings.sent3: The black cat thought it was jinxing the fish by staring at the aquarium.
meanings.sent4: The broken mirror seemed to be jinxing her every move, causing mishaps left and right.
meanings.sent5: The old legend warned of a cursed necklace that had the power of jinxing anyone who wore it.

meanings.definition: The act of bringing bad luck to someone or something
meanings.sent1: The jinxing of the play was blamed on the missing prop that was never found.
meanings.sent2: She felt the jinxing of the event was due to the rain that started pouring down.
meanings.sent3: The jinxing of the picnic turned out to be a blessing in disguise when they found a better spot indoors.
meanings.sent4: The jinxing of the project was like a dark cloud hanging over their heads, making progress difficult.
meanings.sent5: The jinxing of the day seemed to lift when they found a lucky penny on the ground.
